intro: Achillea vermicularis, commonly known as yarrow, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and flat, composite flower heads that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils. Achillea vermicularis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory qualities.
